definition: (written) resignation
old variant of 辭|辞[ci2]
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]
to present to a superior/memorial/petition/to present (a certain appearance)/to assume (a shape)/to be (a certain color)

sentences.english: He has filed his resignation with the manager.
Then Mr Brown departed on the short ride to Buckingham Palace, to tender his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 布朗随后离开，经过一小段路后到白金汉宫递交辞呈。

sentences.english: He decided not to resign but to learn from Bobby.
sentences.chinese: 他决定收回辞呈，并且向博比学习。

sentences.english: Haarde presented his resignation to Iceland's president.
sentences.chinese: 哈尔德周一下午向冰岛总统提交了辞呈。

sentences.english: Juliana gave her notice last week. We need to replace her.
sentences.chinese: 朱莉安娜上周提出辞呈了，我们得找人替补她。

sentences.english: U. N. Ambassador John Danforth submitted his resignation after holding the job for less than six months .
sentences.chinese: 美国大使约翰丹福斯，在上任六个月就提交了的辞呈。

sentences.english: He tendered his resignation to the Prime Minister .
Qin Bing to dean dean submitted his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 秦冰向丁院长递交了辞呈。

sentences.english: The chairman has tendered his resignation.
In addition to Ms. Hu, managing editor Wang Shuo also submitted his resignation, he said on Twitter.
sentences.chinese: 除此之外，胡女士的总编辑王硕也提交了他的辞呈。

sentences.english: He handed in his resignation in protest against the president's European policy.
sentences.chinese: 为抗议总统的欧洲政策他忿然提交了辞呈。

sentences.english: The coach has already turned in his resignation.
Then, I handed in my resignation.
sentences.chinese: 之后，我提交了我的辞呈。

sentences.english: After the banquet, the minister handed in his resignation that very night.
sentences.chinese: 于是，宴会结束后，他连夜向国君递交了辞呈。

sentences.english: He sent in his resignation long ago.
sentences.chinese: 很久之前他就递出了他的辞呈。

definition: to ask sb to resign from a post
to resign
to resign/to quit
to present/to give/to hand over/to hand in/to lay before
to admit responsibility and resign
to be transferred to another post/to post away
to take the blame/to accept responsibility (for a mistake)
certificate of appointment (to government office)
to retire/to leave office/to quit a job
to resign from office/to dismiss from office
to remove sb from their post/to dismiss
to resume a post
to leave office
official letter
to take over (as minister, manager etc)
board of directors
